problem_metadata.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted List
problem_metadata.content:
Given the head of a sorted linked list, delete all duplicates such that each element appears only once. Return the linked list sorted as well.

 

Example 1:

Input: head = [1,1,2]
Output: [1,2]

Example 2:

Input: head = [1,1,2,3,3]
Output: [1,2,3]

 

Constraints:

  • The number of nodes in the list is in the range [0, 300].
  • -100 <= Node.val <= 100
  • The list is guaranteed to be sorted in ascending order.

submissions.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted List
submissions.code:
class Solution:
    def deleteDuplicates(self, head: Optional[ListNode]) -> Optional[ListNode]:
        if head is None or head.next is None:
            return head

        seen = set()
        dummy = ListNode(-1)
        tail = dummy
        curr = head

        while curr:
            if curr.val not in seen:
                seen.add(curr.val)
                tail.next = curr
                tail = tail.next
            # If duplicate, skip it by not updating tail
            curr = curr.next

        # Terminate the list
        tail.next = None

        return dummy.next

submissions.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted List
submissions.code:
# Definition for singly-linked list.
# class ListNode:
#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):
#         self.val = val
#         self.next = next
class Solution:
    def deleteDuplicates(self, head: Optional[ListNode]) -> Optional[ListNode]:
        ''' How to solve this problem....
            Steps:-
            1) Just use the dummy node method and keep a tailpointer and maintain a hashset LMFAO.
            2) DONE TA DA!
            '''

            # First the edge cases.
        if head is None:
            return None
        elif head.next is None:
            return head
        else:
            Hashset : set = set()
            dummy = ListNode(-1)
            tail = dummy
            tail.next = head
                
            curr = head
            while curr is not None:
                if curr.val in Hashset:
                    tail.next = curr.next
                else:
                    Hashset.add(curr.val)
                    tail.next = curr
                    tail = tail.next
                curr = curr.next
            return dummy.next
